hero.title: Setting Sail for a Smoother Journey
hero.subtitle: Discover the story behind SailMate, the revolutionary ferry ticketing system changing how people travel on water.

ourStory.title: Our Story
ourStory.paragraph1: SailMate was born from a frustrating experience at a crowded ferry terminal in 2025. Our founder, waiting in a long queue for tickets, wondered why ferry booking couldn't be as seamless as other modern travel experiences.
ourStory.paragraph2: What started as a simple idea to digitize ferry tickets quickly evolved into a comprehensive platform addressing the unique challenges of waterway transportation. Today, SailMate serves thousands of travelers and dozens of ferry operators worldwide.

ourMission.title: Our Mission
ourMission.description: To transform waterway travel by creating technology that connects people to efficient, stress-free ferry experiences while supporting coastal and island communities.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.description: We pioneer smart solutions to make ferry booking and travel seamlessly efficient.

reliability.title: Reliability
reliability.description: Punctual departures and accurate schedules you can build your journey around.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: Eco-friendly vessels and practices that protect the beautiful waters we sail.

comfort.title: Comfort
comfort.description: Thoughtfully designed spaces and amenities for a relaxing journey across the water.

testimonial1.quote: SailMate transformed how we operate our ferries. Reduced lines, happier customers, better business.
testimonial1.author: Coastal Ferries Ltd.

testimonial2.quote: I use the app for my daily commute across the bay. It's saved me countless hours of waiting in line.
testimonial2.author: Maria J.

testimonial3.quote: Planning our island-hopping vacation was a breeze with SailMate. Seamless connections every time.
testimonial3.author: The Robinson Family

cta.title: Ready to Simplify Ferry Travel?

voyagePage.title: SailMate Voyages
voyagePage.subtitle: Find and book your next sea journey

faqPage.pageSubtitle: Find answers to the most common questions about SailMate's ferry booking services.

quickBooking.title: Quick Booking
quickBooking.description: Get ferry tickets in less than 2 minutes

questions.question: How do I book a ferry ticket with SailMate?
questions.answer: Booking with SailMate is easy! Visit our homepage and use the booking form to enter your departure and arrival locations, preferred dates, and number of passengers. Once logged in to your account, you can select your preferred sailing time, choose additional services, and complete your payment securely. After confirmation, your e-ticket will be sent to your email address and also be available in your account dashboard.

questions.question: Can I cancel or change my reservation?
questions.answer: Yes, you can cancel or change your reservation up to 24 hours before departure. To do so, visit the 'Check Ticket' or 'Cancel Ticket' sections of our website and enter your booking reference number. For cancellations, refunds are processed according to our policy: full refund if cancelled 7+ days before departure, 75% refund for 3-6 days prior, and 50% refund for 1-2 days before departure. Changes are subject to availability and may incur additional fees if the new fare is higher.

questions.question: How early should I arrive before departure?
questions.answer: We recommend arriving at least 45 minutes before scheduled departure for foot passengers, and at least 90 minutes for vehicle passengers. This allows sufficient time for check-in, security procedures, and boarding. During high season (June-August) or on holiday dates, consider arriving 30 minutes earlier than the recommended times to avoid any delays.

questions.question: Do I need to print my ticket or can I use a mobile ticket?
questions.answer: SailMate supports both printed and mobile tickets. For most routes, you can show your e-ticket on your smartphone or tablet during check-in. The QR code on your ticket will be scanned for verification. If you prefer a printed ticket, you can print the PDF attachment in your confirmation email. We recommend having a digital backup even if you bring a printed copy.

questions.question: What happens in case of bad weather or cancellations?
questions.answer: In case of cancellations due to severe weather conditions or technical issues, we will inform you as soon as possible via email and SMS. You will be offered the option to rebook on the next available sailing at no additional cost or receive a full refund, regardless of your ticket type. For significant delays (more than 2 hours), we provide complimentary refreshments at our terminals. We recommend checking our website or contacting our customer service for real-time updates during adverse weather conditions.

questions.question: Is there Wi-Fi on board?
questions.answer: Yes, free Wi-Fi is available on all our ferries. Connection quality may vary depending on your location at sea. Premium high-speed Wi-Fi can be purchased onboard for passengers who need faster connections for work or streaming. Most vessels also have charging stations in common areas for your devices. During busy travel times, bandwidth may be limited due to high usage.

sustainabilityPage.pageSubtitle: SailMate is dedicated to environmentally responsible ferry travel and reducing our carbon footprint.

carbonOffset.title: Carbon Offset
carbonOffset.description: Projects to balance our environmental impact

vision.title: Our Vision for Sustainable Ferry Travel
vision.paragraph1: As a new company founded in 2025, SailMate was built with sustainability at our core. We recognize the critical importance of protecting our oceans and marine environments while providing essential transportation services.
vision.paragraph2: Our goal is to become the most environmentally responsible ferry service in the industry by 2030, setting new standards for sustainable maritime travel from the very beginning of our operations.
vision.paragraph3: Rather than retrofitting older vessels or adapting existing systems, we're starting fresh with innovative technologies, sustainable practices, and forward-thinking partnerships that minimize environmental impact while enhancing the travel experience.

fleet.title: Fleet Sustainability Initiatives
fleet.intro: Our commitment to eco-friendly vessels includes:
items: Investing in hybrid-electric propulsion systems that reduce fuel consumption by up to 30%
Implementing hull optimization technology to reduce water resistance and improve fuel efficiency
Installing exhaust gas cleaning systems (scrubbers) to reduce sulfur emissions
Transitioning to low-sulfur marine fuels ahead of regulatory requirements
Exploring hydrogen and fully electric vessel options for shorter routes
Regular maintenance schedules to ensure optimal engine performance and minimized emissions
fleet.target: 2026 Target: Build our fleet with vessels that produce 30% fewer emissions than industry standards

waste.title: Waste Management & Recycling
waste.intro: We're tackling waste on multiple fronts:
items: Eliminating single-use plastics throughout our operations
Implementing comprehensive onboard recycling programs for passengers and crew
Using biodegradable and compostable food packaging in our onboard cafés
Reducing paper consumption through digital ticketing and communications
Responsibly disposing of all hazardous waste materials
Working with suppliers to reduce packaging waste in our supply chain
waste.target: 2025-2026 Target: Launch with zero single-use plastics and implement 80% waste diversion from landfills

water.title: Water Conservation & Protection
water.intro: Our commitment to marine ecosystem protection includes:
items: Advanced wastewater treatment systems on all vessels to protect marine water quality
Regular cleaning and maintenance of hulls to prevent invasive species transfer
Use of environmentally friendly cleaning products throughout our operations
Fresh water conservation measures on all vessels
Marine wildlife protection protocols, including reduced speeds in sensitive habitats
Partnerships with marine conservation organizations
water.outro: We regularly monitor water quality in our operating areas and participate in coastal cleanup initiatives along our routes.

carbon.title: Carbon Offset Programs
carbon.intro: While we work to reduce our direct emissions, we also invest in carbon offset projects:
items: Reforestation initiatives in coastal areas along our routes
Investment in renewable energy projects
Support for blue carbon projects that protect and restore mangroves and seagrass beds
Partnership with verified carbon offset providers
carbon.outro: Passengers can opt to add a small contribution to their ticket price to support these projects, with SailMate matching every contribution.

terminal.title: Green Terminal Operations
terminal.intro: Our sustainability efforts extend to our terminal facilities:
items: Solar panels installed at major terminals to generate renewable energy
Energy-efficient lighting and climate control systems
Electric vehicle charging stations in terminal parking areas
Shore power capabilities allowing docked vessels to use land-based electricity instead of running engines
Rainwater harvesting systems for terminal maintenance and landscaping
Green spaces and local native plantings at terminal facilities

food.title: Sustainable Food & Beverage
food.intro: Our onboard dining options prioritize sustainability:
items: Partnership with local food producers along our routes
Seasonal menu items to reduce food transportation emissions
Plant-based menu options with lower environmental impact
Sustainably sourced seafood certified by the Marine Stewardship Council
Food waste reduction programs including composting where possible
Reusable or compostable dining materials
food.outro: We're proud to showcase the flavors of the regions we serve while minimizing our environmental footprint.

launch.title: 2025: Launch
launch.description: SailMate begins operations with sustainability as a founding principle. Initial fleet equipped with fuel-efficient technology, zero single-use plastics policy, and comprehensive recycling programs from day one.

expansion.title: 2026-2027: Expansion
expansion.description: Growing our fleet with increasingly efficient vessels, implementing shore power connections, expanding renewable energy use at terminals, and enhancing water conservation systems.

innovation.title: 2028-2029: Innovation
innovation.description: Introduction of hybrid-electric vessels on shorter routes, carbon-neutral terminal operations, and a fully sustainable supply chain from food service to maintenance materials.

leadership.title: 2030: Industry Leadership
leadership.description: Setting new standards for the ferry industry with our commitment to sustainable operations, significantly lower emissions than competitors, positive contributions to marine ecosystems, and innovative clean energy travel solutions.

joinUs.title: Join Our Sustainability Journey
joinUs.description: Help us make a difference by choosing sustainable travel options, participating in our carbon offset program, or sharing your ideas for environmental improvements.

myTickets.title: My Tickets
myTickets.subtitle: View and manage all your purchased tickets
myTickets.noTickets: You don't have any tickets yet.

travellingRulesPage.pageSubtitle: Our vessel rules and regulations are designed to ensure a safe and enjoyable maritime experience for all passengers. Please review these rules before starting your journey.

introduction.title: Maritime Safety and Conduct Regulations
introduction.content: At SailMate, the safety of our passengers and crew is our highest priority. These onboard rules have been established in accordance with maritime regulations and industry best practices. Adherence to these rules is mandatory for all passengers to ensure a safe and comfortable journey aboard our vessels.

items.label: Arrival Times
items.content: Foot passengers must arrive at the terminal at least 45 minutes before scheduled departure. Vehicle passengers should arrive 90 minutes in advance to allow for proper loading sequence and vessel stability calculations.

items.label: Documentation
items.content: All passengers must present valid identification and boarding documents at check-in. Electronic tickets displayed on mobile devices are accepted provided the QR code is visible and scannable.

items.label: Boarding Procedures
items.content: Passengers must follow crew instructions during boarding and disembarkation. Our structured boarding process ensures vessel stability and passenger safety during these critical operations.

items.label: Late Arrivals
items.content: For safety and operational reasons, boarding closes 15 minutes before departure. Vessels must maintain strict departure schedules to ensure navigational safety, thus latecomers may be denied boarding without refund.

items.label: Safety Briefings
items.content: All passengers must be aware of safety briefings provided at the beginning of the journey. These include information about life jacket locations, emergency exits, and muster stations.

items.label: Movement During Transit
items.content: Passengers should remain seated when the vessel is navigating rough waters. When moving around the vessel, maintain three-point contact on stairs and hold handrails to prevent falls during unexpected wave movements.

items.label: Emergency Procedures
items.content: In an emergency, follow crew instructions immediately and proceed to the designated muster station. Do not return to cabins or vehicle decks to retrieve belongings when emergency alarms are activated.

items.label: Restricted Areas
items.content: Engine rooms, bridge, crew quarters, and operational areas are strictly off-limits to passengers. These restrictions are enforced for both security and safety reasons in accordance with maritime regulations.

sections.title: 3. Prohibited Items
sections.intro: Per maritime security regulations, the following items are prohibited on SailMate vessels:
items: Dangerous goods including flammable liquids, gases, or solids that may compromise vessel safety
Explosives, fireworks, or any pyrotechnic devices
Weapons including firearms, ammunition, knives with blades exceeding 6 cm, or any item designed to cause injury
Compressed gases in cylinders except required medical equipment or small camping cylinders stored in vehicles
Illegal substances or drugs
Excessively large or heavy items that may compromise vessel stability or evacuation procedures

subitems.label: Vehicle Restrictions
subitems.content: Vehicles with fuel leaks or other mechanical issues posing a hazard will not be permitted to board. Electric vehicles must have sufficient charge to disembark without assistance.

subitems.label: Confiscation of Items
subitems.content: Prohibited items may be confiscated if found during boarding or during the journey. Items may be returned upon disembarkation or handed over to appropriate authorities as required by law.

items.label: General Behavior
items.content: Passengers must conduct themselves in a manner that does not interfere with the comfort or safety of others. Abusive language, threatening behavior, or actions that disrupt vessel operations are prohibited.

items.label: Smoking Regulations
items.content: Smoking, including e-cigarettes, is permitted only in designated open-air areas on vessel decks that are clearly marked. Smoking in cabins, enclosed areas, or unmarked areas is strictly prohibited and may trigger fire detection systems.

items.label: Alcohol Consumption
items.content: Alcoholic beverages may only be consumed if purchased from onboard facilities. Excessive consumption leading to disruptive behavior will result in drink service restrictions and possible intervention by security personnel.

items.label: Child Supervision
items.content: Children under 12 years of age must be supervised by an adult at all times. Children are not permitted on open decks without adult supervision regardless of weather conditions due to unpredictable sea conditions.

items.label: Luggage Allowance
items.content: Each passenger is permitted one hand luggage not exceeding 10 kg and dimensions of 55 cm x 40 cm x 20 cm. Additional luggage should be checked and stowed in designated luggage compartments.

items.label: Luggage Security
items.content: Passengers are responsible for their personal belongings at all times. SailMate is not liable for lost, damaged, or stolen items. Unattended items may be collected by crew and subject to security checks.

items.label: Valuables
items.content: Valuables should be kept on your person, not in checked luggage. Safe facilities are available for particularly valuable items on longer journeys.

items.label: Deck Storage
items.content: Personal belongings must not obstruct corridors, emergency exits, or public walkways. Items blocking these areas will be relocated by crew members without notice.

items.label: Waste Management
items.content: All waste must be disposed of in appropriate receptacles. Separate containers for recyclable materials, food waste, and general trash are provided in accordance with maritime environmental regulations.

items.label: Marine Conservation
items.content: Throwing any items overboard from the vessel is strictly prohibited and may result in significant fines. This includes seemingly harmless items such as food waste, cigarette butts, or paper products.

items.label: Wildlife Observation
items.content: Maintaining appropriate distance from marine life encountered during the journey is essential. Do not attempt to feed seabirds from open decks, as this disrupts natural feeding patterns.

items.label: Resource Conservation
items.content: Passengers are encouraged to conserve water and electricity during their journey. Please turn off lights when leaving cabins and report water leaks to crew members immediately.

sections.title: 7. Health and Emergency Procedures
sections.intro: Passengers must adhere to the following health and emergency rules onboard:

items.label: Medical Assistance
items.content: Report any medical emergency to crew members immediately. All vessels are equipped with first aid facilities and personnel trained in emergency medical response appropriate for maritime environments.

items.label: Motion Sickness
items.content: If you experience motion sickness, sit in the center of the vessel where motion is minimized. Motion sickness preventative medications are available from the purser's office. If prone to seasickness, stay hydrated and avoid alcohol.

items.label: Evacuation Procedures
items.content: In the event of a possible evacuation, life jackets will be distributed if not already at your seating position. Proceed calmly to the designated muster station following illuminated pathways and crew instructions.

items.label: Weather Events
items.content: During adverse weather conditions, secure loose items and remain seated when instructed by crew. Open deck access may be restricted during high winds or heavy seas for passenger safety.

contactInfo.question: Have questions about our onboard rules?

accessibilityPage.pageSubtitle: We're committed to making ferry travel accessible to everyone. Learn about our accommodations and how we ensure a comfortable journey for passengers of all abilities.

introduction.title: Our Accessibility Commitment
introduction.content: At SailMate, we believe that the open waters should be accessible to everyone. We're dedicated to providing an inclusive ferry travel experience that accommodates the diverse needs of all our passengers. Our accessibility initiatives span our vessels, terminals, digital platforms, and customer service to ensure that everyone can enjoy comfortable and dignified maritime travel experiences.

items.label: Accessible Ferry Design
items.content: Our ferries are equipped with accessible entrances, ramps, and elevators between decks on all large vessels to ensure mobility throughout the journey.

items.label: Dedicated Seating Areas
items.content: We provide dedicated accessible seating areas with panoramic views and proximity to amenities, ensuring comfort without compromising the sea experience.

items.label: Accessible Facilities
items.content: All our vessels feature accessible restrooms on every deck, wheelchair-friendly pathways, and accommodations for service animals.

items.label: Priority Services
items.content: We offer priority boarding and disembarkation for passengers with mobility requirements to ensure a smooth embarkation and debarkation process.

items.label: Harbor Access
items.content: All our ferry terminals feature step-free access throughout customer areas, with accessible paths from parking areas to boarding points.

items.label: Check-in Services
items.content: Wheelchair-accessible check-in counters at a lower height are available at all locations, ensuring comfortable interaction with our staff.

items.label: Navigation Assistance
items.content: Our terminals include tactile paving for visually impaired travelers, along with clear signage and announcement systems in both visual and audio formats.

items.label: Priority Facilities
items.content: Designated accessible parking spaces are available close to terminal entrances, minimizing travel distance to our vessels.

items.label: Website Standards
items.content: The SailMate website is designed to WCAG 2.1 AA compliance standards, ensuring that our digital journey is as accessible as our physical one.

items.label: Booking Accessibility
items.content: Our booking engine includes keyboard navigation for all features, screen reader compatibility, and accessible forms with clear labels.

items.label: Adaptable Interface
items.content: Users can adjust text sizing and access high contrast options to customize their digital experience to their visual needs.

items.label: Simplified Process
items.content: We've created a streamlined booking process that allows passengers to indicate accessibility requirements and request specific accommodations during their reservation.

items.label: Crew Training
items.content: All SailMate crew members receive comprehensive training in disability awareness and how to assist passengers with various needs throughout their maritime journey.

items.label: Embarkation Support
items.content: Dedicated staff are available to assist with boarding and disembarkation procedures, including the operation of accessibility equipment.

items.label: Journey Assistance
items.content: Throughout your voyage, crew members are available to provide assistance with accessing facilities, moving between decks, and addressing any accessibility concerns.

items.label: Communication Support
items.content: Staff are trained to communicate effectively with passengers who have hearing impairments, including basic sign language and use of written communication when needed.

sections.title: 5. Special Accommodations
sections.intro: SailMate offers the following special accommodations:
items: Complimentary tickets for personal care assistants traveling with passengers who require assistance
No additional charges for registered service animals
Priority vehicle loading for vehicles with accessibility equipment
Information available in alternative formats (large print, Braille) upon request
Ability to remain in your vehicle during shorter crossings if mobility challenges make moving to passenger areas difficult
Specialized maritime evacuation procedures for passengers with disabilities

sections.title: 6. Planning Your Accessible Voyage
sections.intro: We recommend taking the following steps to ensure your maritime journey is as smooth as possible:

items.label: Before Booking
items.content: Review our accessibility options or contact our maritime accessibility team at least 48 hours before travel to discuss specific requirements for your voyage.

items.label: During Booking
items.content: Select relevant accessibility options during the reservation process and provide details about any special accommodations you may need for your journey at sea.

items.label: Pre-Departure
items.content: Arrive at the terminal at least 60 minutes before scheduled departure to allow time for priority boarding and any necessary assistance with embarking the vessel.

items.label: During Your Voyage
items.content: Don't hesitate to approach any crew member with questions or requests for assistance – our maritime staff are trained to ensure your journey is comfortable.

contactInfo.question: Need more information about our accessibility services?

termsOfServicePage.pageSubtitle: Please read these terms carefully before using SailMate's ferry ticketing platform. By using our services, you agree to these terms and conditions for booking ferry travel.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: SailMate (the 'Platform') is a ferry ticketing service that allows you to search, compare, and book ferry tickets across multiple operators and routes. The Platform is owned and operated by SailMate Ltd (referred to in these Terms of Service as 'we', 'us' or 'SailMate'). These Terms of Service constitute a legally binding agreement between you and SailMate regarding your use of our ferry booking services.

sections.title: 1. Application
items: These Terms of Service apply to your access to and use of the SailMate ferry booking platform. By accessing or using our Platform, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Service.

We may modify these Terms of Service to reflect changes in ferry operator policies, legal requirements, or our booking services. If we do so, we will notify you by updating the date at the top of these Terms of Service.
If you do not agree to these Terms of Service, you may not access or use the Platform to book ferry tickets.

sections.title: 2. Account Registration
items: To book ferry tickets through our Platform, you may be required to create a SailMate account and provide certain personal and travel information.

You agree to provide accurate, current, and complete information during the registration and booking process. Inaccurate information may result in booking errors or denied boarding by ferry operators.
You are responsible for safeguarding your SailMate account credentials and for all ferry bookings and activities that occur under your account.

items.label: Ferry Ticketing Process
items.content: When you book ferry tickets through SailMate, you are entering into a transportation agreement with the ferry operator. SailMate acts as an intermediary platform facilitating the ticket sale.

items.label: Ferry Ticket Confirmation
items.content: Once your ferry booking is confirmed, you will receive an electronic ticket or booking confirmation by email. You must present this at check-in along with required identification documents.

items.label: Ferry Pricing and Payments
items.content: All ferry ticket prices are displayed in the currency specified during the booking process and may include booking fees. Full payment is required to confirm your ferry reservation.

items.label: Schedule Changes and Cancellations
items.content: Ferry schedules may change due to weather conditions, technical issues, or other circumstances. Cancellation and refund policies vary by ferry operator and are specified during the booking process.

items.label: Check-in Requirements
items.content: You must arrive at the ferry terminal for check-in at the time specified by the ferry operator, typically 30-90 minutes before departure. Late arrival may result in denied boarding with no refund.

sections.title: 4. User Conduct
sections.intro: When using our ferry booking platform, you agree not to:
items: Book ferry tickets for illegal purposes or in violation of maritime or immigration laws
Use fraudulent payment methods or falsify passenger information
Attempt to manipulate pricing, availability, or booking systems
Resell ferry tickets without authorization from the ferry operator
Make multiple speculative bookings that you do not intend to use
Interfere with other users' ability to access our ferry booking services

sections.title: 5. Limitation of Liability
items: SailMate is a ticketing platform and is not liable for the actions, omissions, or service quality of ferry operators, including delays, cancellations, accidents, or personal injury during ferry travel.

We strive to provide accurate ferry information but cannot guarantee the complete accuracy of all schedules, amenities, or services described on our platform, as these are provided by the ferry operators.
Our total liability for any booking issue within our direct control (such as payment processing errors) shall not exceed the booking fee paid to SailMate for the affected ferry ticket.

sections.title: 6. Disclaimer of Warranties
sections.intro: THE SAILMATE FERRY BOOKING PLATFORM IS PROVIDED "AS IS" AND "AS AVAILABLE" WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, REGARDING THE ACCURACY OF FERRY INFORMATION, TICKET AVAILABILITY, OR PLATFORM FUNCTIONALITY.
sections.content: We do not guarantee that our ferry booking platform will be uninterrupted, error-free, or that all ferry services will operate exactly as described. Weather conditions, technical issues, or operational decisions by ferry companies may affect your booked journey. Always check with the ferry operator directly before travel for the most current information.

privacyPolicyPage.pageSubtitle: At SailMate, we value your privacy and are committed to protecting your personal information. We only collect what's necessary to provide our ferry ticketing and booking services.

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.content: This Privacy Policy explains how SailMate collects, uses, and protects information about you when you use our ferry ticketing platform. We respect your privacy and only collect data necessary to facilitate your ferry bookings and provide a seamless travel experience. We do not store your payment card details on our servers or collect any special categories of personal data beyond what's required for your ferry travel. We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. If we make significant changes, we will notify you by revising the date at the top of the policy and, where appropriate, by email.

providedInfo.title: Information You Provide to Us
providedInfo.intro: We collect information you provide directly to us when you book ferry tickets, create an account, subscribe to notifications, or communicate with us. This may include:
items: Contact information (name, email address, phone number)
Profile information (username, password)
Passenger information (names, ages, nationality where required by ferry operators)
Payment information (processed securely through our payment processors, not stored on our servers)
Travel details (routes, dates, times, vehicle information if applicable)
Communications you send to our customer support team

automaticInfo.title: Information We Collect Automatically
automaticInfo.intro: When you access or use our ferry booking platform, we may automatically collect:
items: Log information (IP address, browser type, pages viewed, time spent on site)
Device information (device type, operating system, unique device identifiers)
Location information (with your consent, to suggest nearby ports or routes)
Cookies and similar technologies (to remember your preferences and improve your experience)

howWeUse.title: How We Use Your Information
howWeUse.intro: We use the information we collect to:
items: Process and confirm your ferry bookings
Issue electronic tickets and boarding passes
Send booking confirmations, changes, and travel updates
Facilitate check-in processes with ferry operators
Provide customer support for booking inquiries
Notify you about schedule changes, cancellations, or service disruptions
Process refunds or booking modifications
Improve our ferry route offerings and service
Personalize your ferry booking experience
Prevent fraudulent transactions and ticket fraud
Comply with legal obligations and ferry operator requirements

sharingInfo.title: Sharing of Information
sharingInfo.intro: We may share the information we collect as follows:

items.label: With ferry operators and port authorities
items.content: To process your booking, issue tickets, and fulfill regulatory requirements

items.label: With payment processors
items.content: To complete your ferry ticket payment transactions

items.label: With service providers
items.content: Who help us operate our platform, such as cloud storage, email services, and customer support tools

items.label: In response to legal process
items.content: Such as a court order or subpoena, or to comply with maritime and transport regulations

items.label: To protect safety
items.content: Of passengers, vessels, port facilities, or to respond to emergencies

items.label: In connection with a business transfer
items.content: Such as a merger, acquisition, or sale of our ferry booking business

security.title: Data Security
security.content: We take reasonable measures to help protect information about you from loss, theft, misuse, unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration, and destruction. However, no security system is impenetrable, and we cannot guarantee the security of our systems or your information.

yourRights.title: Your Rights and Choices
yourRights.intro: You have several rights regarding your personal information:

items.label: Account Information
items.content: You can update your account information by logging into your account settings

items.label: Cookies
items.content: Most web browsers accept cookies by default. You can usually set your browser to remove or reject cookies

items.label: Promotional Communications
items.content: You can opt out of receiving promotional emails by following the instructions in those emails

items.label: Data Access and Portability
items.content: You can request a copy of your personal data we hold

items.label: Data Deletion
items.content: You can request that we delete your personal information

contactInfo.question: Have questions about our privacy practices?
